description: Daria Tomenko, leveraging her discreet access and technical know-how, secretly delivers the encrypted Council journal to an Innovator Council liaison. She flags future-dated entries and attaches a note urging confidential investigation, fearing public chaos and hoping to control the information's impact.

Council Innovators review the journal and are stunned by Halden's handwriting predicting policy shifts and social unrest. Immediate debate erupts over whether to act on or suppress these predictions, deepening factional mistrust.

Murmurs of the journal's existence escape internal channels. Council staff, troubled by the implications, quietly spread news of the predictions to trusted colleagues, sowing paranoia and speculation among upper administrative ranks.

Rumors about 'Halden's prophecy' reach BCI engineers and civic leaders. Wild speculation spreads, residents organize preemptive protests and forums, fueled by uncertainty about the Council's next moves.

On the date of the journal's last prediction, rival citizen groups occupy central districts. When the Council defies the forecasted event, spontaneous public celebrations and confusion erupt, further eroding trust in both the BCI and Council authority.
